p: Colias eriphyle occurs in open habitats in the western United States at elevations from 1.4 to 3.0 km. Larvae feed on hostplants in the legume family, including alfalfa, clover, and vetch. Diapause is induced by larval photoperiod and occurs over the winter in the 3rd instar. The timing of onset of larval feeding and of the first adult flight season varies strongly with elevation (see below); and the number of adult generations per year ranges from 4‐5 at lower elevations to 2 at higher elevations (Tabashnik, 1980; Watt, Chew, Snyder, Watt, & Rothschild, 1977; Watt, Han, & Tabashnik, 1979).
